utterance.speaker: Coach
utterance.content: Good explosion! Drive it! Drive it! Drive it!

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: You watching 77?

utterance.speaker: Scout
utterance.content: I'm watching everybody.

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: You don't need to watch everybody. You need to watch 77.

utterance.speaker: Scout
utterance.content: You his agent?

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: Just an objective mom.

utterance.speaker: Scout
utterance.content: His explosion is impressive.

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: It's not just burst. He can pull too. You know, the only reason he went to a Double A school, he was a bit of a late bloomer. He's a big man now.

utterance.speaker: Scout
utterance.content: You should be his agent.

utterance.speaker: Coach
utterance.content: Nice pancake, 7-7! You're moving up those draft boards!

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Thank you, sir!

utterance.speaker: Quarterback
utterance.content: On one, on one. Ready?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Break!

utterance.speaker: Quarterback
utterance.content: Blue 90. Hike!

utterance.speaker: Coach
utterance.content: Good job!

utterance.speaker: Another Coach
utterance.content: Second level, nice!

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Get off my quarterback!

utterance.speaker: Coach
utterance.content: Play's over! The play is over!

utterance.speaker: Coach
utterance.content: Save the aggression for between the whistles!

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: Daryl.

utterance.speaker: Coach
utterance.content: All right, back to work!

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: Daryl.

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: Daryl, stop!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Canoeing. But I seem to be taking on water.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This is not okay. Use your own bathroom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No canoe in my bathroom. My leg hurts. Soaking it makes it feel better. You were the one who had to have this condo. Maybe next time you should consider amenities, like two full baths, instead of just the joy of outbidding Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The guy who signs the loan gets to pick the bedrooms. Stay out of mine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well then, you owe me 35 bucks for the grab rail I installed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hit the kill screen. Boss is here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's not porn. It's our new patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bummer.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: 22-year-old male – 6'7", 310 pounds. Clearly has brain involvement. The guy has no recollection of this entire incident.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Football player. Those are the ones that get hit in the head a lot, right?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: ER CT'd him. No concussion, no stroke, no cortical degeneration.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And he had a full psych evaluation. He's not crazy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So it's roid rage. You don't think they grow them that big naturally.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: ER also tested for steroids. He's clean.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Only proving that our guy got his hands on the good stuff.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The negative test at least means steroids is less likely. We should discuss other possibilities.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why? He injects his sore ankles with lidocaine every game. You think he's above injecting steroids?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Repeated head trauma could damage the base of the brain, leading to a pituitary adenoma, which leaks GnRH.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Pituitary damage wouldn't be visible on a CT scan.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could cause the excess hormones that could cause the rage and would elude the ER Steroid test.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. Bilateral venous sampling to find the elevated GnRH. MRI to find the pituitary damage. Unless, of course, there is no pituitary damage, in which case, our guy got his hands on the good stuff.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Foreman. Let the peasants handle the peasantry. Your brother needs to get picked up this afternoon... from prison. Your older brother, in case your confusion is related –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How do you know about that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He left a message. Said he couldn't get you on your cell or at home. I get it. You're busy. You'll pick him up the next time he comes out of prison.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Is that all?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're officially unbusy. Family is family. Take the rest of the day. Go see your brother.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I have work to do.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Do you feel any pain that's deep and persistent, not just muscles or joints?

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Everything hurts all the time. That's football.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It might not be just football. We're gonna test for damage to your pituitary. If there is, it could create excess hormones, which could be causing your pain. It would also explain your rage attack.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: And if my pituitary is damaged, how long would it take to treat?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don't want to get ahead of ourselves and start promising deadlines.

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: I-I'm sorry, doctor, but he's playing in front of pro scouts, coaches, and GMs this Saturday. This is the job interview for the rest of his life.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If we do find something wrong, we can go in through the nose and repair the damage – nothing too invasive. You'll need a couple days of recovery, and then we can have you back by game time.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Thank you, doctor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's nothing wrong with your eyes.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: Well, then your gizmo's broken. I'm seeing spots.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or you enlisted, you got the cool haircut and the awesome pants, then you realized that your plane ticket to the Middle East was coach, and you decided to rethink your promise.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: No. I've already been there – three deployments. Now they want me to go again. But my wife's pregnant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So our homeland should be unsafe because your private was unsafe.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: Look, my wife and I planned this perfect. My enlistment was supposed to be over last week, so we got pregnant six months ago. Now they tell me I'm getting stop-lossed – Army speak for they don't care about the fact that I've already finished my contract.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't care about the fact that they don't care.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: Hey, come on. I waited an extra hour just to make sure I got you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: I saw you limping out there. Vietnam?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Viet?!? How old do you think I am?

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: I don't know, Vietnam age?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, back in my day, the real dodgers had the stones to run up to Canada or shoot themselves in the foot. They didn't come to free clinics whining for doctors' notes. Go hug your wife. Tell her to get a babysitter. You'll be back in time to video the kid's first steps.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't need to see the scan. I can tell from your little puppy-dog eyes that his pituitary's fine. Are you gonna say it, or should I?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You were right about the steroids. You're a genius.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Next time with feeling. Put the cheater on a somatostatin analog to clear it out of his system. Send him back to his football game.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: I've never done steroids.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Well, somehow your GnRH got elevated. This will help get it back down.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Mom, I swear.

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: Who's gonna draft you, Daryl? You're stupid enough to try that stuff, especially the week you know you're getting tested.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: You guys must've mixed up your labs or got somebody else's blood, because I’ve never –

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: Okay, what is that?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Tachycardia. Lay back down, Daryl.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Why's my heart beating like this?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's not steroids. I need some adenosine! And get that crash cart over here!

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Oh. Oh.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House, next time – Marcus.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, right. You two know each other.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: Uh, interviewing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh! Who are we kidding? Interview's over. You got the job.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What job?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My new assistant. Part of his parole – he needs a job. Just trying to do my part.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You were wrong about the steroids. Patient had a paroxysmal tachycardia. We cardioverted him back to sinus rhythm. We're gonna get an EKG and a sestamibi scan. Marcus... let's talk outside.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Family is family.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: Hey. Good to see you too. Did you have a hard stretch? No, not bad. I hardly got raped at all.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You can't work here.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: Well, your boss says I can.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm not playing.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: Lighten up. Man, this could be fun. I get to see your world. You get me access to the pharmacy. I am playing. Come on, man. You look good. I'd already know that if you came to visit every once in a while, but whatever, I get it. It–it's cool. You don't want to see me. You don't want to pick me up. It's all justified. I'll just have to win you back over.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Let me explain something. This man who's offering you the job – he's not a philanthropist.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: He seems more helpful than you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He doesn't want to help you. He only wants to use you to screw with me.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: You know how you can screw with him? Act like your brother getting a job doesn't screw with you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Trust me, it'll be better for both of us if you go back in there and tell him you can't take the job.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: I'm not a person who has the luxury of turning down jobs.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Well, figure something out... 'cause you cannot work here.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ho-wah!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay. Oh! Oh!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We spent all night, used all the fancy machines. Patient's heart looks fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, if it was fine, it wouldn't go aflutter just 'cause you walked into the room.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: Light whip, two extra shots.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you, sir. Judging by the look on your face, I assume you're upset that big bro didn't take your advice and skip town.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You told him about our conversation?

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: He bought me breakfast.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was fun. Put lunch in the books, just you and me.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Our patient could have a PFO.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, naturally, you jump right to a urinary issue.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: PFO's not urinary. It's a heart issue.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It is? Hmm. Well, naturally, you think it's not a urinary issue, 'cause you're so embarrassed about your own past urinary issues, you don't dare broach the subject. Oh, come on. You spending the night over at Bobby Samson's.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I did not wet the bed. I spilled a drink.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're not buying it, Eric. We never bought it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why are you telling him these things?

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: What's the big deal? It was 25 years ago.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Oxygenated and deoxygenated blood mix, the rough flow causes a clot, explains the heart and head.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: Like that power forward from Loyola Marymount, when he, um...

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hank Gathers? That's not what happened to him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Let your brother speak. What happened to Hank Gathers?

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: Conference tournament – Alley-oop dunk, jams it home. Then he runs up the court and splat. He dropped dead of a heart thing right there on the court.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I remember that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Rage and tachycardia are warning signs.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Seriously? Because my brother remembers a basketball game?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, I don't care where an idea comes from, as long as it makes sense and embarrasses someone.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Are you out of your mind?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: As a former psychiatric patient, I take offense at that terminology.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: All I did was ban you from my tub. Whatever happened to proportional response?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whatever happened to coherent conversation?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That... thing... broke tiles, gashed the walls, and pooped everywhere. Expect a bill for repairs... And payback.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have no idea. Everybody else thinks hypertrophic cardiomyopathy makes sense? Good. Stick the patient on a treadmill. Stress his heart until it stops.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You want to induce cardiac arrest?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Only real treatment is for the patient never to stress his heart again, which means we have to tell him to retire at the ripe old age of 21. Stopping his heart speaks louder than words. Go.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Maybe it's a good thing. He gave your brother a job, responsibility.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm not arguing that he shouldn't have a job. I just don't want him having one here.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I understand that House did this to annoy you. But why is he succeeding?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: you know what my brother did the last time he got out of prison? He stole money from my parents to buy drugs. He robbed a liquor store. Then he moved on to jacking luxury cars –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Last time.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Every time. I've known my brother for over 30 years. You haven't even known him a day.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The exterminator charged $250 to get the opossum out of there, and the contractor estimates $1,500 to fix the bathroom. And why are you jerking Foreman around?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because it's fun. Maybe you should give those bills to the guy who left his own bathroom window open.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Your motives always run deeper than simple fun.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I want to learn more about one of my employees so that I can manipulate him and destroy him if and when I choose. Information is power.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not buying it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. Why don't you tell me my real evil plan?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I don't think there is an evil plan. You regret not having a relationship with your own family, and you don't want to see Foreman go down that same path. I think you're actually… being nice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, shut up. You can't accuse me of an opossum attack and underhanded kindness in the same visit.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Then I'll come back.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Treadmill test was a bust. The guy's in unbelievable shape. We couldn't get his heart rate above 150.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Your boss is secretly a very nice man.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If we can't re-create the cardiac event, we can't prove hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Either we find a bigger treadmill... or...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did I miss the memo about you being released?

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: I'm feeling fine. I can't keep laying here in this bed missing practices.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All excellent points. Give me your arm.

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: What's in the shot?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a vasodilator. Since we can't exercise your son's heart on the treadmill, I'm gonna have to do it chemically.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're turning white.

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It means he doesn't need football to get a good job anymore.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Raynaud's phenomenon – Vasospasms cut off the blood supply to his fingers. Could be early onset rheumatoid arthritis.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Rheumatoid factor is negative.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Arterial plaque throwing clots would explain the fingers, head, heart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You really think a guy with stenosis could've aced that treadmill test?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're kidding me. You got him a desk?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And a nameplate. Man's got to have a place he can call his own.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What about Takayasu's arteritis?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Lymphoma's a better fit. We should remove his spleen.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Bold move to skip straight to surgery.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His big game's coming up. We don't have time to biopsy, wait for the pathology report, and resect.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Right. We should remove his spleen without confirmation so he won't miss the big game.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hang an ethanol drip.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That won't treat for either lymphoma or Takayasu's.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If it's lymphoma, the ethanol will make him itchy, and Foreman can remove his spleen. If it's Takayasu's, he'll lose his radial pulse, and Chase can start him on steroids.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Marcus!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: My new assignment is to shadow you in enemy territory and document your every word to the patient. Just don't say anything stupid.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're not an idiot. Don't do this.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: Come on, man. I'm a new person now – no more drugs, no more lying. And if I can't get my own family to give me an opportunity to prove that, then what's the point?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Mom and Dad gave you a chance and a second and a third. I'm not about to give you a 54th.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why isn't your minion fetching your lunch?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's busy spying on his little brother.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That's very demeaning.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You obviously have a theory as to why demeaning is not demeaning.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're escalating to prove I was wrong about you being nice, which you would only do if I was right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you even listen to yourself?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: 23-year-old just came into the E.R., asked for you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's her cup size?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't think his cup size is relevant to his condition. He accidentally shot himself in the foot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh! Seriously? I give you a choice between moving to Canada and shooting yourself in the foot, and you chose the bullet?

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: I didn't want to be a fugitive.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think this is gonna get you discharged? We'll patch it up and send you right back.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: Don't patch it up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Look… You got screwed over by your own government, and that sucks. But all you're gonna get out of this is a five-day vacation and a band-aid.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: When I signed up, I was just a guy. Now I'm about to be a dad. I go back over, there's a chance my kid grows up without a father.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You got a girl pregnant. You're still just a guy.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: How much longer we have to wait?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We have to keep going until you start feeling something.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Might help if, uh, you told me what I'm supposed to feel.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If I do that, that's all you'll be thinking about. Then you'll be telling me that's what you're feeling. Power of suggestion.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: The other black dude who was in here earlier, he your brother?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What gave it away?

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: The way you looked at him. I have two older brothers, and we always want to kill each other.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Oh. Mm.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Something wrong?

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Not really. It just feels itchy. Is that what you're waiting for?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Means lymphoma's most likely, but that's actually good news.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: How could that be good news?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Because it's treatable. We can remove your spleen tonight laparoscopically.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Will I be able to run by Saturday?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We can get to the radiation in the off-season.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Hey, Ma. Wake up, Ma. Wake up. I'm itchy. Means I can play.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ahh.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh. What are you doing in the dark?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lying in wait.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Jeez. What happened to your face?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right... Play innocent. Like you weren't looking for revenge for the prank that I didn't pull.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's karmic justice, but I didn't do it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Of course you realize, this means war.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Isolating the gastroepiploic artery. Nearly there. Foreman, come and take a look at this.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Liver's inflamed. So the itching wasn't caused by his spleen.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What happened to your face?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wilson annexed the Sudetenland.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No abnormal "T" cells or "B" cells. It's definitely not lymphoma. Liver biopsy only revealed nonspecific inflammation.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kind of like the time you took your mom's birth control pills on a dare and ended up with swollen nipples.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That never happened.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right, and your nickname all the way up through high school wasn't Erica.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It wasn't.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: Okay, I may have made that one up, with the understanding that my brother still had a sense of humor and would figure out to play along.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Polymyositis would explain the head, liver, heart, even the white fingers.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It would also be accompanied by a significant decrease in muscle power. Marcus! A chance to redeem yourself. Does our patient look strong to you? Sorry, Eric. Big brother disagrees with your diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Felty syndrome?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You said the liver was inflamed, not the spleen. Can you believe they let this guy perform surgery?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Requesting permission to share my idea without being belittled in front of your new assistant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Permission denied. Continue.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Our patient has cartilage damage in both ankles. He gets lidocaine shots before every game to mask the pain. Team doctor uses the same needle twice by accident, viral hepatitis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: D’you think he's an idiot, Marcus?

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: I don't think he's an idiot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. Go test his blood. Come on. We have a lunch scheduled.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, you jerked me around. Your allegiance lies with your brother. I get it. Admirable. But here's the problem. I hired you to tell me the truth. If you don't do that, you no longer have a job.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: I don't know what secret you're looking to uncover, but my brother is a decent guy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He was arrested for grand theft auto.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: You're gonna be disappointed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Try me.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: He tell you I was with him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Was it your idea?

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: We did everything together. I don't know whose idea it was. I was 16. He was only 14. Little punk couldn't even see over the steering wheel. He's quicker with a flathead screwdriver than most people with a key.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sorry to interrupt my character assassination with boring medical stuff, but when we drew the patient's blood, it clotted right there in the vacutainer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So the problem is not in his blood, it's the blood itself.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's been working out in the cold doing two-a-days. It's got to be cryoglobulinemia.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I usually love breaking bad news. But in this case... start the patient on warfarin. I'm so sorry about that. You were saying...

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: We drove for about ten minutes before we got caught, and that was it. When our mom came down to the station, she didn't say a word the whole ride home. She came up to the driveway, turned off the car. We're sitting in there in silence. Then without turning around, she said, "I'll pray for you." And she got out of the car.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. You got off easy.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: Easy for you, easy for me, not easy for Eric. His life mission became to never disappoint our mother like that again, because he is a good guy. I thought he would tell that story at the eulogy. But I heard he didn't give one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Y–your mother's dead?

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: If he didn't tell you, I'm sure he had a reason. Look, you can mock him all you want about peeing in the bed, but... please... don't bring up our mother.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Your blood contains an abnormally high volume of certain proteins called cryoglobulins. They become thick when it gets cold outside. It's like a car trying to run after the oil's turned to sludge. We think that's what's been causing all your problems.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: So I just need a quick oil change and I'm good to go.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: This oil change isn't so quick. We have to put you on blood thinners and other medications. The process will take two to three weeks. But after that, you should be able to play without a problem.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: After that, it's not gonna matter.

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: Doctor, if Daryl doesn't play in front of the scouts on Saturday, he won't get drafted. Can't you wait until after the game?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If we wait and let him play, there's a good chance he dies right on the field.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I had an epiphany.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Usually that precedes you walking away with purpose, so...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Flathead screwdriver.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And then I say...?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not a game. It's proof that you didn't rig the grab rail and make me fall.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I already have proof of that – The fact that I didn't do it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can't go on that. But I can go on the fact that I had to borrow a flathead screwdriver from Nora to install the thing, 'cause we only had a Phillips-head. And then, of course, I returned it late that night in a completely successful effort to see her braless...

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Whoa. Wait. Wait a minute. Wait a minute.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which means that you didn't have the tool to sabotage the grab rail.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Braless under, like, a sweater or, like, a – like, a –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now I also have proof that I'm not responsible for the opossum, because I'm absolving you of responsibility instead of escalating, which you know is not my nature.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So someone is breaking into our place just to screw with us?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The opossum... was meant for me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm so tired. It was exciting till about 2:00 A.M. Now it's just torture.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you even go to college?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This is the escalation, isn't it? Keeping me up all night, nothing happens, then you keep me up all night again tomorrow. This is your retaliation.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You see, that's just illogical, 'cause I'm staying up too.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Maybe you napped all day.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I gave you empirical proof that I did not prank you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No. No, you did not. You created empirical proof that I didn't prank you, selling me on the notion that you didn't prank me. Maybe you self-pranked.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't master-prank.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Is that cut on your cheek even real?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See, this is exactly what our nemesis wants – divide and conquer. Can't you see that?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay. I'm going to bed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm telling you, if you sleep now, you're gonna wake up next to severed horse heads. Or worse, the rest of it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh! House! The flat screen!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ah. Ah. You would never sacrifice the flat screen.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, this guy is good.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: is there a reason for this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Zer is a reason for everything, mes amis. I am tro-bled to report that we have a criminal in our midst.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Guilty of what exactly?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Last night, the fire sprinklers flooded our apartment. And before that, I found an opossum in my bathtub.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You each had motive. You each had opportunity.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: This is the emergency you paged me about?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not so fast, Mademoiselle Cuddy. No one leaves here until they can account for their whereabouts on the evening last.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, no one who is employed by me leaves here until they account for their whereabouts the evening last. What about you, Professor Chase?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why would I?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because you hold me responsible for breaking up your marriage.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I was here all night with Thirteen, monitoring our patient's IV blood thinners.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can either of you prove that?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The patient's alive and improving. Is that proof enough?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For now. What about you, Colonel Taub?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I was out to dinner with my wife.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really? Your wife.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes, really.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good enough. 'Cause I had you pegged all along. You certainly had all the motive in the world.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: First of all, I'm not interested. Second, I don't even know where you guys live.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yesterday I confirmed that you are a liar.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, at least a liar by omission.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: House! Don't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get this, class. Foreman's mom died. He ever tell any of you?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, I think you're getting off topic here.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Is he serious? Did your mom pass away?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: About three months ago.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why didn't you tell anybody?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And to top it off, you refused to say anything nice about her at the funeral.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I didn't talk because it isn't anyone's business.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: Stop. You don't have to explain yourself to this guy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You want to hit me, don't you?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Marcus, don't.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: I quit.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You should stop him. He needs this job.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Our patient needs a fresh IV

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: I don't need two or three weeks. See? Got my color back.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That means you're getting better. But it doesn't mean –

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: It means I am better. My coach had the team doctor come by. He cleared me to play.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Did your team doctor realize you're on blood thinners?

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: I'm off them now.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're still sick. You're not ready to go off your meds.

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: Daryl, listen to him. It is not worth the risk.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: I'll come back on Sunday, Mom. You guys can give me all the meds I need then.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The treatment doesn't work that way.

utterance.speaker: Glenda
utterance.content: Please go with him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Antibiotics aren't working. We're gonna switch you to different ones, but you're gonna lose your toe.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: Outstanding, soldier.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: As a general rule, before you celebrate, do a little research. The army's medical evaluation board is perfectly fine with nine-toed infantrymen, as long as they can walk and run.

utterance.speaker: Jim
utterance.content: So I lost a toe for nothing?

utterance.speaker: Hose
utterance.content: Afraid so. Unless you want me to keep you on the old antibiotics, let the infection spread, and we could amputate more than just a toe.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why are you risking your life for this? Your mom doesn't want you to.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: My mom sacrificed everything for me. Her telling me not to come here is just another example of that. I do good out there, I could take care of her for the rest of her life. Who am I if I don't sacrifice for her? That's family.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Everything's blurry. I can't see. Take me back to the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The blindness means we were wrong about his –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Actually, I'm responsible for that. Spiked his water bottle with nitrates, dropped his blood pressure, robbed oxygen-rich blood from his brain, making him blind. Figured a temporarily blind patient is better than a permanently dead one. Vision was already coming back by the time I dropped him off at the hospital.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well played. If only we could combine your medical chicanery with your brother's ability to fetch me mochas, you'd be the perfect Foreman. Where are you?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm busy.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Great. So we don't have a new symptom.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Means we should just stick him back on his blood thinners, and he should be okay to leave in a couple weeks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, we do have a new symptom. Any of you take a look at his readmittance chart? Between the time he checked in and the time he rechecked in, our patient lost a single pound. Patient like that would usually shed over ten pounds.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The obvious answer would be steroids, but since we've already ruled them out...

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So he's not injecting. But he could be getting them naturally – Paraneoplastic syndrome. The body produces antibodies, which battle cancer, which could also act like growth hormone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We've eliminated lymphoma. What other cancers mimic growth hormone?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Lung, pancreatic, renal, breast –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was a rhetorical question. I don't really care. Go test him for all of them.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You need a job. Maybe I can talk to House, see if I can get your job back.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: Soon as he knows you're okay with me being there, he won't want me back.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe I can help you figure out something else.

utterance.speaker: Marcus
utterance.content: I promise... I won't let you down.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Don't do that. Let's just... See how it goes. So, uh, do they mandate you to stay here at the halfway house? Or… can you come stay with family?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's Foreman.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, it should stop now that Marcus left.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, that's the whole point –

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry. Was my leg sticking out? I'm so distracted lately, trying to think of something funnier than fire sprinklers going off in the middle of the night. Any ideas?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Whoa, easy there, tiger. I know where you live. You know how I know? 'Cause my girlfriend and I – we tried to buy that very same condo.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why don't you leave me out of this? Wilson was the one who bought the place.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: And you're living there. You... deserve to suffer equally.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, I suffered more now that you just tripped me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey, hey, I-I-I'm –

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: His suffering will equal out, 'cause he actually feels remorse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why would you out yourself? You can't even imagine the retribution.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Oh, there won't be any. I am ceasing all offensive operations. I have both made my point and established my superiority. And if you even get to the planning stages of retaliation, I will tell Cuddy that she lost her dream place to you two. See, she's under this odd impression that you guys are her friends.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There's no cancer. We scanned him head to toe. We checked blood smears for leukemia. We even ultrasounded his chest looking for breast cancer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe I was wrong about the weight loss.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You weren't wrong – we found blood in his catheter bag. His kidneys are failing.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So it has to be cancer. Paraneoplastic syndrome is the only thing that can link kidney, heart, and liver – even the rage.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why can't we find it? We've looked everywhere inside this guy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What if it's not inside?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know why you're black?

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: 'Cause God loves me more than he loves you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hmm. What I was going for was melanin. You got lots of it. It makes your skin dark, protects you from the sun's harmful UV rays.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Unfortunately, it also prevents even those with advanced medical degrees from considering melanoma as a diagnosis. Other hand. On the rare occasion that black people do get skin cancer, they usually get it on the white parts – palms and soles of the feet. But your hands and feet are so smashed up from football, my team are likely to have written off any skin blemish as a bruise. But now that I know that melanoma is the only thing that fits... Come take a look at this, Mom. There's the thorn in the panther's paw. Paraneoplastic syndrome. Your body forms antibodies to fight the tumor. Those tiny little proteins travel through your blood and wreak havoc. We remove the cancerous mole, everything should be fine. I'll tell Dr. Chase to schedule the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Daryl
utterance.content: Why bother? I missed my shot. What kind of life am I gonna lead now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you study really, really hard? Then the same crappy life that the rest of the guys you'll be graduating with are gonna lead... minus the student loans.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Hey. You ready?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Almost. And… done. I heard House and Wilson are getting pranked by someone. You wouldn't know anything about that, would you?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why should I believe you?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: You said I had a trusting face. I still don't understand why you wouldn't let me retaliate, though. They stole your dream.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, that's overstating it. It's just a condo.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: It's not because you feel guilty about hurting House or guilty for being with me?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We'll buy another one. I just don't see the need to make a war out of it.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Well, I think you're rationalizing, which a less confident man than myself might take as a sign that you're second-guessing. Okay, you know what? Forget that last part.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I heard Foreman and his brother are trying to work things out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's nice for them.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's nice of you. You didn't provoke Marcus to quit so the pranks would stop. You were becoming the common enemy they could bond over. You are the diabolical, yet benevolent puppet master.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I provoked Marcus to quit because he was no longer useful to me. I hired him to get information. I got information.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Uh-huh. And how are we gonna get back at Lucas?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're not.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I win.
